clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Outcomes for Youth Receiving Hospital-based Violence Prevention With and Without a Community-level Initiative
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Outcomes for Youth Receiving Hospital-based Violence Prevention With and Without a Community-level Initiative

collaborator.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to test if a hospital-based violence prevention strategy with a community-level initiative is effective for cross-cutting violence prevention in violently injured youth.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will test if youth who receive the Bridging the Gap (BTG) and Communities that Care (CTC Plus) will see greater improvements than youth who either receive BTG only, CTC Plus only or no intervention. This study will allow researchers to learn more about the intervention's effectiveness for a range of violent outcomes. It will also help researchers understand if violence prevention efforts affect other behaviors, such as drug use and rates of violent re-injury.
Participants will be asked to complete surveys about their behavior, personality, and experiences, and their parent/child's personality, behavior, and experiences. These surveys take about 45-60 minutes to complete. These questionnaires will be completed before the intervention has taken place and then again 6 months later. Participation in this study will last up to 6 months. Approximately 408 individuals will participate in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in youth violence - self report
Change in youth violence - caregiver report

primary_outcome.description: Self-report physical and psychological dating aggression

secondary_outcome.description: Hospital records of number of youth participants who experienced another injury due to violence between the intervention and 6-month follow-up
Self-report: Number of community resources youth are engaging in
Study report: The number of youth who we are unable to complete the follow-up assessment for because they are unreachable or decline to continue participation.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Hospital-based violence prevention with community initiative
arm_group.description: Youth who are living in communities that receive Communities that Care Prevention System (CTC) will also receive Bridging the Gap (BTG), a hospital-based violence prevention program with 6-months of community case management.
Youth who do not live in a community that has CTC but will receive BTG.
Youth living in a community without the CTC program and will receive treatment as usual (TAU) in the hospital.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Treatment as usual with community initiative
arm_group.description: Youth living in a community with the CTC program and will receive treatment as usual (TAU) in the hospital.

intervention.description: Bridging the Gap is a hybrid model for violence prevention which integrates a hospital-based brief violence intervention (BVI) delivered to the patient while in hospital with a wrap-around community case management prevention strategy.
intervention.arm_group_label: Hospital-based violence prevention with community initiative

intervention.description: In CTC programs stakeholders elect evidence-based prevention strategies that are most appropriate for their community. These evidence-based strategies target their community's specific needs, such as reducing risk factors while supporting and increasing protective factors.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Violently injured youth receiving treatment at VCU
2. Aged between 12 and 21 years old
3. Living in Richmond City
1. Parent/caregiver of the youth participant 2. Parent/caregivers must be 18 years old or older
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Non-English speaking
2. Ages <12 and >21 years
3. Prisoners are excluded

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized data will be available for sharing.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be made available after the main study findings have been published and up to five years after study completion.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data are available for sharing with researchers requesting data from the Principal Investigator. Interested investigators will be required to complete a Data Use Agreement Form which outlines the specific data being requested and a summary of the research question(s). Distribution of data and associated documentation will be subject to review by the research team (PI and study team). The Data Use Agreement provides a commitment to: a) use the data only for research purposes, and not to identify any individual participant, b) secure the data using appropriate security measures and computer technology, and c) destroy and/or return the data after analyses are completed. The interested investigators shall provide the data analytic plan and study aims for the PI and study team's approval.
